title: Should private schools be banned? - Quora

response.answer_text: in my opinion, private schools should not be banned since it can be a last resort for well off or middle class parents to send their kids there if they’re living close to public schools that's known for being dangerous, low staffing, a well known gang presence in that school, lack of school supplies and materials, and poor teaching quality. most teachers working at these private schools would be shattered once they lose a job with good pay that can pay off their student debt and ensure great financial success. they would have to go to a public school, if unlucky, where the pay is bad, students constantly being unruly towards the teachers or to a student during class (i’ve witnessed this when i was a student in middle to high school in the city), having to deal with low numbers of textbooks and supplies either due to low funding caused politics or the school test scores being so bad the government cuts back on the funds and grants on that school. public schools are far more stressful to the teacher and demoralizing the worser the school is. of course there are private schools that are subpar due to greed or just scams that are being beaten by other public schools if they’re are less dangerous, teachers paid well (rise in quality teaching), low amounts of students being part of gangs will do little harm to school safety, the students not having problems at home will do better in school, funded generously where new textbooks are abundant and teaching teachers how to use technology efficiently will have an easier time explaining to students. the idea of banning private schools is a lazy plan. the problems some public schools are facing will still be there once private schools are banned.
